title: Explained: What Happens Next In Israel-Iran Conflict
content: Israel's invasion of Lebanon this week and Iran's missile attack on its regional foe, all while war rages on in Gaza, have heightened the risk of a high-intensity conflict across the Middle East.
summary: Israel's invasion of Lebanon this week and Iran's missile attack on its regional foe, all while war rages on in Gaza, have heightened the risk of a high-intensity conflict across the Middle East.

title: Google Tests Verified Check Marks In Search Results For Certain Companies
content: Alphabet's Google is testing showing check marks next to certain companies on its search results, a company spokesperson said on Friday, in a move aimed at helping users identify verified sources and steer clear of fake websites.
summary: Alphabet's Google is testing showing check marks next to certain companies on its search results, a company spokesperson said on Friday, in a move aimed at helping users identify verified sources and steer clear of fake websites.

title: Drone Launched From "The East" Killed 2 Soldiers, Says Israel
content: The Israeli army on Friday said a drone launched "from the east" killed two soldiers, with a public broadcaster reporting the strike originated from Iraq and hit a base in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights.
summary: The Israeli army on Friday said a drone launched "from the east" killed two soldiers, with a public broadcaster reporting the strike originated from Iraq and hit a base in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights.

title: A Year After She Was Taken Hostage, Israeli Girl Adapts To New Family Life
content: Israeli couple Leron and Zoli Mor have identical tattoos on their arms showing a procession of eight elephants, their tails and trunks intertwined.
summary: Israeli couple Leron and Zoli Mor have identical tattoos on their arms showing a procession of eight elephants, their tails and trunks intertwined.

title: US Army Tests Robot Dogs Armed With AI-Enabled Guns: Report
content: The US Army is testing robot dogs mounted with AI-enabled guns at a military facility in the Middle East, according to Military.com.
summary: The US Army is testing robot dogs mounted with AI-enabled guns at a military facility in the Middle East, according to Military.com.

title: Over 2,000 "Military Sites" Hit During Ground Incursion In Lebanon: Israel
content: The Israeli army on Friday said its forces had hit more than 2,000 sites during its four-day incursion into southern Lebanon targeting Hezbollah positions.
summary: The Israeli army on Friday said its forces had hit more than 2,000 sites during its four-day incursion into southern Lebanon targeting Hezbollah positions.

title: India's EaseMyTrip Resumes Maldives Bookings After "Improved Ties"
content: Travel tech platform EaseMyTrip - which suspended flight bookings to Maldives in January after a diplomatic row with India - on Friday said it has resumed bookings to the island nation after "improved bilateral ties" between both governments.
summary: Travel tech platform EaseMyTrip - which suspended flight bookings to Maldives in January after a diplomatic row with India - on Friday said it has resumed bookings to the island nation after "improved bilateral ties" between both governments.

title: Spanish F-18 Fighter Jet Crashes While Flying Low, Pilot Dies
content: A Spanish Air Force pilot died when an F18 fighter plane crashed Friday in eastern Spain, officials said.
summary: A Spanish Air Force pilot died when an F18 fighter plane crashed Friday in eastern Spain, officials said.

title: Malaysia Man Sets Son's Bike On Fire After Discovering His Racing Addiction
content: A father in Malaysia set his son's motorbike ablaze in a desperate attempt to protect him from potentially deadly accidents.
summary: A father in Malaysia set his son's motorbike ablaze in a desperate attempt to protect him from potentially deadly accidents.

title: S Jaishankar To Visit Pak, First Foreign Minister There Since Sushma Swaraj
content: S Jaishankar will visit Pakistan later this month to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, becoming the first External Affairs Minister to do so in nine years. The last visit was by Sushma Swaraj in 2015.
summary: S Jaishankar will visit Pakistan later this month to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, becoming the first External Affairs Minister to do so in nine years. The last visit was by Sushma Swaraj in 2015.

title: 8 Days To 8 Months: Sunita Williams, Barry Wilmore's Extended Stay In Space
content: The Boeing Starliner lifted off the International Space Station in June with NASA's veteran astronauts, Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore, the mission was intended to last for eight days but a technical failure delayed the astronauts' return.
summary: The Boeing Starliner lifted off the International Space Station in June with NASA's veteran astronauts, Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore, the mission was intended to last for eight days but a technical failure delayed the astronauts' return.

title: Antarctica Turning Green At An Alarming Rate, Says Study
content: From a meagre 0.4 square miles in 1986, the vegetation cover reached almost 5 square miles in 2021, the study found.
summary: From a meagre 0.4 square miles in 1986, the vegetation cover reached almost 5 square miles in 2021, the study found.

title: S Jaishankar To Travel To Pak, Last Foreign Minister Visit Was In 2015
content: India on Friday announced that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will travel to Pakistan to attend a conclave of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) in mid-October.
summary: India on Friday announced that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will travel to Pakistan to attend a conclave of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) in mid-October.

title: Our Allies In The Region Would Keep Fighting Israel: Iran's Supreme Leader
content: Iran's supreme leader vowed in a rare address on Friday that his allies around the region would keep fighting Israel, as he defended his country's missile strike on its arch-foe.
summary: Iran's supreme leader vowed in a rare address on Friday that his allies around the region would keep fighting Israel, as he defended his country's missile strike on its arch-foe.

title: Video Of Bride Taped To Pole In Wedding Ritual In China Sparks Outrage
content: The video, reportedly from Shanxi province in China, has the bride screaming and calling for help as the men continue to bind her, with no one intervening.Â
summary: The video, reportedly from Shanxi province in China, has the bride screaming and calling for help as the men continue to bind her, with no one intervening.

title: "India Must Convince Israel": Iran's Ambassador To NDTV On West Asia Crisis
content: As the conflict in West Asia is poised to set off a series of dangerous escalations risking full-scale war between Iran and Israel, Iran's Ambassador to India Iraj Elahi today sought India's intevention to help bring stability to the region.
summary: As the conflict in West Asia is poised to set off a series of dangerous escalations risking full-scale war between Iran and Israel, Iran's Ambassador to India Iraj Elahi today sought India's intevention to help bring stability to the region.

title: Maldives President's 1st Bilateral Visit To India From Sunday
content: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu will be visiting India from October 6 to 10, the foreign ministry said today.
summary: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu will be visiting India from October 6 to 10, the foreign ministry said today.

title: Russia Decides To Remove Taliban From Terrorist Groups List: Report
content: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Friday that a decision to remove the Taliban from a list of terrorist organisations had been "taken at the highest level", the state TASS news agency reported on Friday.
summary: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Friday that a decision to remove the Taliban from a list of terrorist organisations had been "taken at the highest level", the state TASS news agency reported on Friday.

title: Opinion: Who - And What - Will Fill The Vacuum In Iran's Resistance Axis?
content: History is littered with examples of how non-state militant actors, driven by ideology, are easily able to bulldoze their way to power before regional or international consensus-led political alternatives even start materialising.
summary: History is littered with examples of how non-state militant actors, driven by ideology, are easily able to bulldoze their way to power before regional or international consensus-led political alternatives even start materialising.

title: Australian Court Orders Musk's X To Pay $418,000 Fine In Child Abuse Case
content: An Australian court upheld an order on Friday for Elon Musk's X to pay a fine of A$610,500 ($418,000) for failing to cooperate with a regulator's request for information about anti-child-abuse practices.
summary: An Australian court upheld an order on Friday for Elon Musk's X to pay a fine of A$610,500 ($418,000) for failing to cooperate with a regulator's request for information about anti-child-abuse practices.
